WorkItem.Description:
I'd like a new keyword ("include" would work) that would merge all top-level exported symbols from a module file into the scope where the include keyword appears.

Example:
    module MyNamespace
    {
        include "file1"
        include "file2"
    }

assuming file1.ts exports a class `MyClass1` and file2.ts exports a class `MyClass2`, the code would now have access to `MyNamespace.MyClass1` and `MyNamespace.MyClass2` including static type information.

Permitting symbols to be included into the global namespace would be excellent, too, so that .ts files that export a module specify which 'namespace' the classes they contain reside.

For developers that prefer a class-per-file methodology, this feature would be extremely useful for simplifying code and reducing redundancy compared to using import alone.

Comments.Message:
For reference I think we should link to this stackoverflow question (from the same author as the request):
http://stackoverflow.com/questions/12882748/how-do-you-put-multiple-external-modules-into-the-same-namespace-in-typescript
I agree. This is sorely needed if you use the AMD conventions and want to have one class per file.
